issue.title: [CF 753] TMW fails to play a sound
issue.body:
IMPORTANT: If your issue is only occurring with a specific icon, include an export string of the icon in this ticket. Subsequently, if the issue involves an entire group or an entire profile, include the entire export string of the group or profile.

To get an export string, open the icon editor, and click button labeled "Import/Export/Backup". Select the "To string" option for the appropriate export type (icon, group, or profile), and then press CTRL+C to copy it to your clipboard.

FAILURE TO COMPLY WITH THE ABOVE INSTRUCTIONS WILL RESULT IN YOUR TICKET BEING INVALIDATED.

What steps will reproduce the problem?
1. Create a new group
2. Add a sound at an event handler, e.g. "On show"
3.

What do you expect to happen? What happens instead?
A sound is supposed to play when an icon appears. Instead, TMW does not play any sounds regardless of whether the sound is custom or basic or the type of event at event handler is changed (even the most simple one - left click event - does not trigger TMW to play a sound). It just fails to play any sound at all. In the client settings sound is turned on.
When I click on the icon of the sound in the event handler settings, the sound is played normally.

What version of TellMeWhen are you using? ("The latest" is not a version)
6.1.1

Do you have an error log of what happened?
-

Please provide any additional information below (including any export strings if applicable; see above.)
I am not sure whether it is necessary to provide any export strings for this ticket as this problem occurs with TMW just "out of the box".
P. S. I do not have any issues with the sound anywhere else on my PC.
Thanks.


> Posted by CurseForge user cegthlhekz | Imported from CurseForge issue #753 | Raw

comments.body:
So, just to be sure, when you are in combat, you can hear swords clanging, fireballs exploding, etc., but TMW sounds aren't working at all?

Also, are you trying to use one of the sounds that are already listed in TellMeWhen, or are you trying to use a custom sound?

I would like the export string of an icon that this isn't working with, yes.

Edited Feb 7, 2013

> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras
